entry.title: Always evaluate SW routers when non-fetch sources exist
entry.content:
This CL resolves the confusing behavior of Chrome that the registered

SW routers are never evaluated when the service worker does not have

any fetch handlers or only has empty fetch handlers.

However, note that even after this CL, Chrome will still skip router

evaluation when the routers only have 'fetch-event' source and the SW

only has empty fetch handlers.

entry.title: Rename //net/base/mac directory to //net/base/apple (4/n)
entry.content:
This renames the remaining directory in //net/base used both by macOS

and iOS, following the naming convention and changing it something more

suggestive.



Like suggested by mark@, this renaming process will be carried on in

three steps:



1. Rename net/base/mac to net/base/apple, creating new temporary

forwarding headers in net/base/mac that #include net/base/apple.



2. Convert all of the use sites from net/base/mac to net/base/apple.

This can be done across multiple ch anges if desirable, which could make

things more manageable for reviewers. The changes here are performing

this step in the remaining of the //ios directory, using the following

command:

LC_CTYPE=C find . -type f -exec sed -i "" "s:net/base/mac/:net/base/apple/:g" {} \;



3. Remove the temporary forwarding headers in net/base/mac, so that

we’re only left with net/base/apple.



Bug: 1519486

Change-Id: Ifcf51d1ae3645001495bfec579d0f6be85966b55

entry.title: Consolidate pointer attribute testing
entry.content:
The primary goal of this patch was to address memory leaks. These

leaks were likely due to pending promises at the completion of the test.



The 3 tests for hover pointers, non-hover pointers and hover with

right click were all very similar in structure and were consolidated

in the patch. We now have 5 variants instead of 3 separate tests.



In the process the tests were modernized to be promise tests instead

of an async test. The structure was reformatted to remove the manual

test feel.



Bug: 1430360, 1499775, 1446799

entry.title: Fix tab drag crash from libwayland: unknown object
entry.content:
In some tab drag corner cases, e.g. switching to target window using

Alt+Tab before completing the drop on Gnome, the compositor may not send

an `action` event on the `wl_data_offer` object. But when the drag

completed a `finish` was still being sent to the compositor regardless

which should only be sent if an `action` was received as per spec.



The compositor was sending some event on the `wl_data_offer` object even

after it was already destroyed if the `finish` was sent in that case.



While the root cause is the compositor not sending the `action` in

certain causes, ensuring `finish` is requested only if an `action` is

received to comply with the spec avoids the crash.



Bug: 1463941

Change-Id: I22010a4d683afc18abe99691c53301d2272005ce

entry.title: Multiplanar: Add R16F format and use that if supported
entry.content:
This changes adds SinglePlaneFormat::R_F16 which is used when

texture_rg and half_float_linear extensions are available for software

pixel upload through VideoResourceUpdater. This allows us to use

LUMINANCE_F16 format as fallback only when R_F16 is not available and

makes it consistent when switching to multiplanar shared images with

16f channel formats.



This change also drops the GLES2_WRITE usage when using RasterInterface

which in turn should use RasterDecoder and go through

WrappedSkImageBacking which should handle gles read/write appropriately.



Once multiplanar shared image support for VideoResourceUpdater lands,

we can then remove both R_F16 and LUMINANCE_F16 usages thus making

this SinglePlaneFormat support a temporary change.



Bug: 1465939

Change-Id: Idc77ca7c8523dd07371476ce30dbc4804d19f9d9

entry.title: [ios] Add Tips Notifications opt-in for SetUpList context menu
entry.content:
When using the long-press context menu on any SetUpList MagicStack

module, a menu item is presented to allow the user to opt-in to Tips

notifications.



In order to support this and future notification opt-in flows, a new

NotificationOptInAlertCoordinator is added to facilitate asking iOS for

notification permission, but falling back to an alert to send the user

to iOS Settings if the user has previously denied this permission.



GIF of the UI flow:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4coEDWk3cWVj29Q.png

entry.title: Revert "Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1a754aaf4bbf5bc9352e55a32f537cce0e43dcba.



Reason for revert: Consistently failing Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan Tests:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20%281%29



Sample run:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/55842/overview



Original change's description:

> Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret.

>

> - If there is space to the right of the caret, place the Picker widget

> to the right of the caret and try to vertically align the Picker

> search field with the caret.

> - Otherwise, place the Picker widget above or below the caret.

>

> Since we want to align the Picker search field with the caret, we only

> position the Picker widget after PickerView layout has happened.

>

> Note that various cases still need to be dealt with (e.g. when there is

> a selection instead of a caret). We'll handle these cases in followups.

>

> Bug: b:320787410, b:322281223

> Change-Id: I7cf427f3c8aa1e229c7a1cdcae1e3939457905aa

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5233749

entry.title: Move filling timestamp from FillingContext to FormStructure
entry.content:
We are targeting renaming FillingContext to RefillContext, as it is

mainly used for refills and not every "filling" related information is

stored in it.



One thing that is used outside of refills is the filling time. This CL

moves it out of the struct and into FormStructure.



This CL also modifies the nature of the variable from `original`

filling time to `last` filling time, as this would be more appropriate

with its usage.



The CL also records it for field by field filling, which initially did

not set it.



Bug: 1517894

entry.title: [Autofill] Simplify ContentAutofillDriver initialization
entry.content:
The DriverInitHooks have two jobs:

(1) create a {Browser,Android}AutofillManager;

(2) call some setters on AutofillAgent.



Since the introduction of ContentAutofillClient, the DriverInitHook

can be conveniently turned into a member function of the client.



This CL introduces *two* new methods in CAC:

(1) CreateManager(), to be called by CAD's constructor.

(2) InitAgent(), to be called by the CAD factory.



The point in time they're called is important:

- CreateManager() is called before OnContentAutofillDriverCreated(),

which is necessary for TestAutofillManagerInjector;

- InitAgent() is called after OnContentAutofillDriverCreated(),

which avoids trouble with double binding mojo remotes when

TestAutofillDriverInjector creates a new driver.



Alternatives I considered are:

- Calling CreateManager() from the factory. This would avoid the

potential problem of the manager calling into the driver during

the driver's construction. Rejected because this requires

CAD::set_autofill_manager(), and since driver and manager

have to point to each other, there will always be some kind of

chicken-egg problem.

- Calling InitAgent() from CAD's constructor. Rejected because

- tests that mock an AutofillAgent would attempt to bind *two*

remotes, which isn't allowed;

- unbinding and rebinding remotes

- makes writing tests harder;

- seems not to work for the renderer -> browser remote.

- Calling CreateManager() and InitAgent() or only InitAgent() from

a virtual CAD::Init() function, which is be called by the CAD

factory. Tests would override Init() and only call CreateDriver(),

not InitAgent(). Rejected because that'd make writing tests harder.



The DriverInitHook model worked similarly, but it probably worked

out of luck: the DriverInitHooks didn't actually call

GetAutofillAgent() in most tests, which happened to avoid the

double bind in all relevant tests.



Bug: 1200511

Change-Id: I339a8b0e7531a76395e5e50dba16f77e3385f56a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224630

Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1252040}

entry.title: Request bold trait in system UI font matching
entry.content:
Sometimes, when we match Mac system UI font by italic traits and then

adjust weight and width variations [0], we end up getting a CTFont

which has a correct `wght` variation axis value, but it's trait value is

not updated.



This behaviour was only observed for Mac's system UI font of size 14px,

see [1] or for the same Mac system UI font in the smaller sizes (i.e.

<8px), compare [2].



This CL proposes a workaround solution that adds bold trait if

requested, in addition to italic trait, during system UI font matching.



[0] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/fonts/mac/font_matcher_mac.mm?q=MatchSystemUIFont

[1] https://crbug.com/1520661

[2] https://crbug.com/1516731



Bug: 1516731

Change-Id: Id375df428de5de242d5dcca48aed6c71863298af

entry.title: Retry restarting Netty server
entry.content:
* Previously, the http2 test server wouldn't signal to the code under test

if it started correctly or not which resulted in deadlocks and time-out since

a response was never recieved from the server. I changed that to correctly

propagate the start-up signal.



* I changed the restart logic to keep trying for restart the server for

a duration of 10 seconds with 0.5s of sleep between each try. This should

(hopefully) decrease our flakiness in theory until we find a better solution



Bug: 1519471

Change-Id: I38abea276cba21c8d4c2fe200abb165095e0c6ba

entry.title: Reland^2 "Automated T* -> raw_ptr<T> rewrite 'refresh'"
entry.content:
It reverts the revert commit 89730423d1288fbd719f41205617ae79e1180c75

*and* undoes the rewrites in lock_impl.h (see PS2), which caused

crbug.com/1520734, possibly crbug.com/1518884 and regressions in

crbug.com/1519816 (and merged issues).



Original change's description:

> Automated T* -> raw_ptr rewrite "refresh"

>

> PS1: automated rewrite

> PS2-PS5,PS7: unrewrite to fix compilation

> PS6,PS22: unrewrite non-automated exclusions

> PS8-PS20: apply DanglingUntriaged

> PS21: unrewrite to undo binary size increase

> PS23: remove no-longer-needed RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION, #includes & comments

>

> The code has changed since the "big rewrite" so some exclusions no

> longer apply. But also, the rewriter changed too:

> - No longer applies constexpr-related exclusions (raw_ptr<> support

> was added)

> - union exclusion has been waived for std::optional and absl::variant,

> since they invoke raw_ptr<>'s ctor/dtor correctly

> - Certain paths under //base are no longer need to be excluded, as

> PartitionAlloc/raw_ptr no longer depends on them

>

> This CL also tries to popularize a better format of exclusion reasoning

> comments, e.g.:

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of, #global-scope

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: Performance reasons ...

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of; Also: Another reason

> One comment per block of fields will suffice, if the reason is the

> same throughout, and no other comments are added in between.

> This format has advantages, like brevity (no more "not a raw_ptr<>

> because" blurb), and improved scriptability.

>

> Bug: 1446392

> Change-Id: I784ff0e461b2105bc01ad7b8570bb462613b24ce

> DanglingUntriaged-notes: automated rewrite.

> AX-Relnotes: n/a.

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190661

> Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

> Commit-Queue: Bartek Nowierski

> Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

> Owners-Override: Keishi Hattori

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1247373}



Bug: 1446392

Change-Id: I2a2e8d97763d4ac8b7528359587689fd48e300dc

DanglingUntriaged-notes: automated rewrite.

entry.title: [css-nesting] Use-count CSSOM modifications on signal-affected rules
entry.content:
CL:5201402 added signaling rules, which makes it possible to trigger

a use-counter when those rules affect the cascade.



However, signaling rules are intended to be used together with

a corresponding invisible rule (CL:5201055) that appears in a certain

position vs. the signaling rule. This becomes too hard to maintain

when CSSOM can modify the child rules of style/grouping rules

arbitrarily, so we won't attempt this. This CL instead adds

a use-counter to track such CSSOM modifications.



Bug: 1517290

Change-Id: I800fa639ee1afae826ce64c03f24389dc0d89dfc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5217252

entry.title: Introduce autofill address model for India.
entry.content:
The CL introduces the generated code for the IN address model. The model

is currently disabled, as it's still not complete. It's missing

formatting expressions and synthesized nodes handling. These will come

in follow-ups.



The CL also includes some improvements to the i18n api test. We now

make sure that only the api interface is tested and does not account

for implementation details (e.g. removes direct access to

`kAutofillModelRules`)

entry.title: [text-autospace][text-spacing-trim] Update `text-spacing` shorthand
entry.content:
This patch updates the `text-spacing` shorthand parsing:

1. Update the initial value and supported values as per the

resolution at:

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9511

2. Change the logic to handle `normal` as both properties

accept `normal` after the spec change above.

3. Fix the canonical order to match the [spec] (`spacing-trim`

comes first).



Current supported values of longhands are:

* `text-autospace`: `normal`, `no-autospace`.

* `text-spacing-trim`: `normal`, `trim-start`, `space-all`,

`space-first`.



The `text-spacing` shorthands support values above and `none`.



[spec]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#text-spacing-property



Bug: 1463890, 1463891

Change-Id: I8a047f4b87ba728e2f577301b5a1fc3ce824341e

entry.title: [css-nesting] Add signaling rules to aid use-counting
entry.content:
The CSSWG wants to change a few things about how "bare declarations"

work. Instead of "shifting up" those declarations to the rule's main

declaration block, we want to treat them as wrapped by an &-rule,

except with parse-time expansion of selectors instead of the normal

behavior for '&' [1][2]. The parse-time expansion part also affects

our existing implicit wrappers generated by bare declarations within

nested grouping rules (e.g. nested @media). Those wrappers rules may

get their specificity lowered.



Actually making these changes is easier said than done, since we now

have to worry about the compat risk. A naive use-counter added

previously [3] shows that ~0.16% of page loads at some point parse

bare declarations after a nested rule. This is too high, and we

need a more advanced use-counter. Also, it doesn't cover

the specificity change for the (existing) implicit wrapper rule.



This CL is the first in a chain which (hopefully) gives us

the tools needed to use-count for these changes.



The "signaling rules" added by this CL, are simply normal style rules

which carry a "signal" that is converted to a use-count (or not)

later (see CSSSelector::Signal for more detail). This alone is not

enough to cover the cases we care about for [1] and [2], so for now

this new capability is not used outside of tests.



[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/8738

[2] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9492

[3] https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4709



Bug: 1517290

Change-Id: Iad193ff1da07039b9876fadd413f5c9654be08ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201402

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Move WebView autofill client to shared location
entry.content:
This change is a noop. (Visually and behaviourally.)



It moved the aw_autofill_client to android_autofill. This meant to introduce a hook to the successful java-object creation (which counts

as clean-up since the client ceases to call its parent).

Delegation to the platform has already been located in the

components/android_autofill directory. Important code like building

the virtual view structure and filling are embedder-independent and

handled in (still used) AutofillProvider class.





Besides these two calls, the implementation is fully shared and

enables the delegation of all autofill work to a third party,

see follow-up for E2E integration and screencasts:

https://crrev.com/c/5173252

entry.title: Always replace device placeholders in DoH URI templates
entry.content:
Currently, if the DoH URI template contains placeholders for device

identifiers these placeholders are ignored for unaffiliated users.



This is incorrect because the template delimiters are not URL encoded

and it breaks the DoH server assumptions regarding the size of the

identifier replacement.



This CL changes the current logic by hashing and hex encoding the

value of the placeholder name for users which are not affiliated.



E.g. the replacement for ${DEVICE_ASSET_ID} is

uppercase_hex(sha256(VALUE_NOT_AVAILABLE)).



Bug: b/315422225

Change-Id: If142d012b11379a9c44aa71389463c43609736ae

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5211015

entry.title: CCNS: clear the fallback surface when BFCaching CCNS page
entry.content:
When activating a BFCached page, the browser will display the fallback

surface before the new frame is painted. This surface may contain

sensitive information especially when it was originally loaded with

"Cache-Control: no-store" header. This CL clears the fallback surface

from the PageLifecycleStateManager when it receives the

"in_back_forward_cache` acknowledgement from the CCNS page.

entry.title: updater: Add legacy support for the runtime mode
entry.content:
The updater now supports command lines of the form:

`UpdaterSetup.exe /install "runtime=true"`

`UpdaterSetup.exe /install "runtime=true&needsadmin=false"`

`UpdaterSetup.exe /install "runtime=true&needsadmin=true"`



The "runtime" argument in the tag tells the updater to install itself

and stay on the system without any associated application. The updater

will stay on for at least `kMaxServerStartsBeforeFirstReg` wakes. This

feature is used to expose the COM API to a process that will install

applications via that API.

Example:

`"runtime=true&needsadmin=true"`



Fixed: 1064792

entry.title: Don't recompute (shadow) predictions unnecessarily
entry.content:
For every active and non-active PatternSource, predictions are computed

in DetermineHeuristicTypes() by calling ParseFieldTypesWithPatterns(),

rerunning all the parsing logic.



If the patterns are very similar, the hope was that

AutofillEnableCacheForRegexMatching will prevent a lot of the duplicate

work. This seems true to some extend; based on offline measurements,

the overhead of computing shadow predictions for an additional

PatternSource with the same patterns is about a factor of 1.76, not 2.

(Presumably, since it's an LRU cache, the cache is not particularly

effective)



This CL adds an additional optimisation: If all patterns of the shadow

PatternSource are the same as the (already computed) active

PatternSource for the given page language, simply reuse those

predictions. With that, there's no measurable performance overhead

anymore.



Likely, we won't be rolling out new regexes all the time. So this saves

users CPU cycles on every page load.



Technically, this is implemented by precomputing the equality during

compile time, while transpiling the JSON files.



Bug: 1479353

Change-Id: I294cf9c1b119463c24df4752cfb966e010ecab1f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5200177

Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251958}

entry.title: Add basic logic for positioning the Picker widget near the caret.
entry.content:
- If there is space to the right of the caret, place the Picker widget

to the right of the caret and try to vertically align the Picker

search field with the caret.

- Otherwise, place the Picker widget above or below the caret.



Since we want to align the Picker search field with the caret, we only

position the Picker widget after PickerView layout has happened.



Note that various cases still need to be dealt with (e.g. when there is

a selection instead of a caret). We'll handle these cases in followups.



Bug: b:320787410, b:322281223

entry.title: [//media] Unconditionally disable VideoFrame->WebGL 1c upload on Android
entry.content:
[1] disabled this codepath on Android with a "reverse killswitch" to

re-enable. That CL landed in 120 [2], which has now been in stable for

almost 2 months with no problems reported. This CL removes the reverse

killswitch to unconditionally disable the codepath on Android.

entry.title: [CSC][Zoom] Added MediaStreamDeviceObserver::OnZoomLevelChange
entry.content:
Make the MediaStreamDispatcherHost, in the browser process, inform

MediaStreamDeviceObserver, in the render process, whenever the zoom

level of a captured tab/window/screen changes. This helps:

1. Lets the CaptureController store the value and expose it via

synchronous calls to getZoomLevel(). (Previously, these were async.)

2. Lets the CaptureController fire an event whenever this happens.



Bug: 1466247, 1521672

Change-Id: Ie26c69f41cee0f0c0f4d449a77a3b1c37d07314c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5210353

Reviewed-by: Elad Alon

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251937}

entry.title: Move Background drawing logic out of `AshNotificationView`
entry.content:
This is preliminary work before we add a new

`ConversationNotificationView`.

This CL simplifies the `AshNotificationView` class by moving

out a few styling functions and constants as well as logic

to draw the background. This will make it easier to create

new notification view classes that share the same styling

logic. Background drawing logic has also been

removed from `ArcNotificationView`.



Also, this CL moves `SetNotifyEnterExitOnChild` from

`NotificationViewBase` to `MessageView`.



Bug: b:284512022

entry.title: WebUI: Enforce querySelector<Type>() pattern via ESLint, part 4.
entry.content:
A common misuse of querySelector/querySelectorAll is to use a type cast,

like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...) as Type



instead of leveraging the type parameter, like

this.shadowRoot.querySelector(...)



In this part turning off 'no-restricted-syntax' checks for two CrOS

folders (ui/file_manager/ and c/test/data/webui/chromeos/) that exhibit

a lot of violations, so that the check can be enabled by default in the

top-level ESLint configuration in an upcoming CL.

entry.title: Deferred Spare Renderer for top chrome WebUI
entry.content:
This CL adds a new feature to defers the creation of new spare renderer for top chrome WebUIs to avoid the potential resource contention.



There are two delay modes:

1. Fixed-Time Delay: Triggered by 'kSpareRendererWarmupDelay', it sets a

predefined delay.

2. Dynamic Delay: Enabled with

'kSpareRendererWarmupDelayUntilPageStopsLoading', delays until page load

completion.



The Fixed-Time Delay is for studying the correlation between resource contention and the observed delays in Tab Search startup time, while the

Dynamic Delay ensures the avoidance of resource contention during the creation of the new spare renderer.



I will set up Finch experiments to see if there are real resource

contention issues during spare renderer creation.



Bug: 1517067

Change-Id: Ic93f6c9b1ec7ebcb62f7a01741b3021409a6e0bd

Summary

entry.title: [SWAutoPreload] Refactoring around recording UMAs
entry.content:
This is a preliminary rafactoring CL to make subsequent changes easy.



Before this change, the name prefix of the histogram, which is related

to data transfer operations, were defined inside the member function,

ReadAndWrite(). This makes difficult to record UMAs having same prefix

in other functions.



After this CL, the new private function

RecordMojoResultForDataTransfer() is introduced, which contains the

histogram prefix. Other functions can record UMAs by calling this

function.

entry.title: Add DeprecateUnloadOptOut 3rd party trial.
entry.content:
This allows frames to opt out of unload deprecation by unconditionally

allowing unload event handlers regardless of any Permissions-Policy.



I tried to make a more precise effect which would allow

Permissions-Policy to remain in effect but just prevent the default

from being changed to disabled for unload however plumbing origin

trials through to the PP defaults turned out to be quite difficult.



Bug: 1508676

Change-Id: Ib5bbba8ee3112b1b5ef837fe3364edcfcc704fea

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5004469

Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

Commit-Queue: Fergal Daly

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251887}

entry.title: MessagePumpEpoll: Migrate from pipe to socketpair in tests
entry.content:
This CL picks up the CL:5064411 to add `NestedNotification` test

case and disable by default. It also removes pipe in favor of socketpair

in tests, and clears legacy code.



CL:5064411:

> Regression test for MessagePumpLibevent/Epoll

>

> If an FD watcher runs a nested RunLoop on an FD event, and another

> watcher for the same FD cancels the outer watcher's watch from within

> the nested RunLoop, we'll UAF in MessagePumpEpoll today.

>

> This is not something we currently hit in production, but we will if

> we fully migrate MessagePumpLibevent to MessagePumpEpoll; so migration

> is blocked on this bug.

>

> This is a regression test for the bug. Namely:

>

> MessagePumpLibeventTest.NestedNotification/1

>

> should crash due to this bug.

>

> Bug: 1469529

> Change-Id: I335c213437b6766aa9101fa013ed5a2e3f02ac65



Bug: 1469529

Change-Id: Ib3a36f061f3cd695533671362906353c20dfd0a9
